examples: This throw was fair; the white cow came to earth again; and before it could rise Santa had made the lasso fast around a post of the corral with a swift and simple knot, and had leaped upon the cow again with the rawhide hobbles.

entries.meaning: (countable) A whip made from twisted untanned leather.

verbs.description: rawhide (third-person singular simple present rawhides, present participle rawhiding, simple past and past participle rawhided)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To clear (a pump) of sediment by starting and stopping it repeatedly.
(transitive) To beat with a rawhide whip.
